newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ Govt still plays tax cuts for 1998 and after.
newsitem.headline: NZ Govt still plays tax cuts for 1998 and after.

text.p: Treasurer Winston Peters said on Thursday tax cuts beyond 1998 would depend on economic and fiscal conditions.
"We can look forward to legislated tax cuts in July 1998," Peters said in his Budget speech, referring to NZ$1.1 billion of cuts already in law and due to take effect on July 1, 1998.
"Beyond 1998, economic and fiscal conditions permitting, the government will plan for futher tax reductions," Peters said.
But he said the results of a referendum on compulsory superannuation to be held in September "will have a bearing on the shape and form of these future tax reductions".
